title: Debate Night
description: Simulate a high-stakes, live debate with moderators, opponents, and a live audience. Every response shapes voter perception and Election Week outcomes.
purpose: Practice handling a wide range of policy and values-based questions, maintaining composure under pressure, and communicating with clarity, persuasiveness, and consistency.
readingSummary: 1. Preparedness → Understanding key issues and prior positions.
2. Adaptability → Responding to unexpected questions and moderator challenges.
3. Consistency → Aligning answers with campaign identity and earlier statements.
4. Audience Awareness → Reading reactions and adjusting tone accordingly.

components: Moderator Questions → Economy, foreign policy, social issues, local concerns.
Opponent Challenges → Real-time rebuttals and fact-checking.
Live Audience → AI-simulated applause or jeers reflecting audience response.
Fact-Check Phase → Moderator verifies answers against prior statements.

tasks.prompt: Participate in the AI-simulated debate by responding to 20–25 questions (typed or speech-to-text). These include policy questions, ethical dilemmas, and real-time rebuttals.
tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates clarity, persuasiveness, composure, consistency, and voter approval impact.

potentialOutcomes.effects: +5–10% voter approval, +500–1000 CC, increased media coverage, momentum boost.
Voter confidence drops 3–7%, CC stagnates, opponent gains narrative advantage.

outcome.description: Debate performance affects voter approval, credibility, and campaign momentum. Candidate demonstrates ability to manage high-pressure interactions while staying aligned with campaign identity. CC and signatures adjust based on debate effectiveness.

nextModule.title: Final Summary
nextModule.description: Compiles final campaign results and delivers narrative outcomes based on the entire simulator journey.
